intro: Oreocome depauperata, commonly known as the poorflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually pale or yellowish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Oreocome depauperata is considered a rare and specialized species.
